skill.name: brenda-database
skill.description: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equations, organism data, and substrate-specific enzyme information for biochemical research and metabolic pathway analysis.
skill.summary: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equatio...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes Python scripts that query the BRENDA SOAP API and can write output files and plots. Network use is expected for database access, and file writes are scoped to user-specified outputs. No obfuscation or hidden execution paths were found in the scanned files.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable enzyme kinetics and reactions is time consuming. This skill queries BRENDA and structures results for analysis and reporting.
actual_capabilities: Search enzymes by substrate or product using BRENDA queries
Parse Km and reaction entries into structured fields
Export kinetic data to CSV, JSON, or Excel files
Generate kinetic and substrate plots as PNG images
Build pathway reports with feasibility scores
limitations: Requires the external brenda_client module and valid BRENDA credentials
Needs network access to the BRENDA SOAP API endpoint
Plotting requires matplotlib and seaborn, exports need pandas
Data coverage depends on BRENDA records and rate limits

use_cases.title: Find kinetic constants
use_cases.description: Retrieve Km and kcat values for a target enzyme and compare organisms.

use_cases.title: Design pathways
use_cases.description: Build candidate enzymatic pathways and export a feasibility report.

use_cases.title: Create visuals
use_cases.description: Generate plots of kinetic distributions for reports and presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Get Km values
prompt_templates.prompt: Get Km values for EC 1.1.1.1 and list the organism, substrate, and Km value.

prompt_templates.title: Compare organisms
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare alcohol dehydrogenase Km values across E. coli, S. cerevisiae, and Homo sapiens.

prompt_templates.title: Export kinetics
prompt_templates.prompt: Export kinetic data for EC 2.7.1.1 to CSV and summarize how many entries were exported.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway report
prompt_templates.prompt: Find a pathway for lactate with up to 3 steps and generate a pathway report file.

output_examples.input: Find Km data for EC 1.1.1.1 in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
output: Found 12 Km entries for EC 1.1.1.1 in Saccharomyces cerevisiae
Typical conditions: pH 7.0 to 7.5, 25 to 30 C

best_practices: Use specific EC numbers and organism filters to reduce noise
Add delays between requests to respect BRENDA rate limits
Cache results locally when reusing the same queries
anti_patterns: Querying with broad wildcards in high volume loops
Running exports without verifying dependency installs
Assuming missing data means the enzyme does not exist

faq.question: What platforms does this support?
faq.answer: Works with Python scripts on systems that can access the BRENDA SOAP API.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Yes, BRENDA enforces rate limits and account quotas.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the scripts return structured data and can export CSV or JSON.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere else?
faq.answer: Queries go only to the BRENDA SOAP endpoint using your credentials.

faq.question: What if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Check BRENDA_EMAIL and BRENDA_PASSWORD and confirm API access.

faq.question: How does this compare to web scraping?
faq.answer: It uses the official SOAP API, which is more stable and structured.
